class.title: Visual Storytelling
class.description: ARTC 1392 is a Macintosh computer class and will focus on the creative aspects of storytelling as it pertains to digital photography. The basics of story-boarding techniques will be presented. A digital camera is strongly recommended. Students who register for ARTC 1392-2001 must also register for ENGL 1301-2045.

The basics of story-boarding techniques will be presented. A digital camera is strongly recommended. Students who register for ARTC 1392-2001 must also register for ENGL 1301-2045.

class.title: Digital Imaging II
class.description: ARTC 2305 will focus on more advanced and creative aspects of Adobe Photoshop and is taught online with an online orientation. Requires access to the Internet, using a current browser (not AOL), e-mail, and Adobe Photoshop CS2 for your particular operating system. Prerequisite: ARTC 1302 or instructor approval required. class.title: 2D Design
class.description: ARTS 1311-2003, Two Dimensional Design, and ARTS 1312-2002, Three Dimensional Design, will be offered in collaboration. Students will work on the elements and principles of design through a coordinated series of assignments which transition from illusionary space to physical space. These linked sections are highly recommended for students majoring in art.

These linked sections are highly recommended for students majoring in art.

class.title: Biol for Non-Science Majors I
class.description: Orientation will be Aug. 27 at 7 p.m. in Room K121. An online orientation is also available. Most assignments, tests and quizzes are online. A midterm exam, lab practical 1 & 2 and the final exam will be taken in a DCCCD campus testing center or some other preapproved supervised testing site. Content includes biology in the modern world, DNA, genetics and the cell. For more information contact pShelp@dcccd.edu

class.title: Cultural Studies
class.description: CUST 2370, section 2001, Mexico: A Cultural Perspective. This theme-driven, multicultural, interdisciplinary course will study the historical, political, social, religious, artistic and business traditions of Mexico. Students must have Internet access and a current e-mail address. Students may obtain a free e-mail account by logging onto www.BrookhavenCollege.edu, then click on "N" for NetMail.
class.alt-description: CUST 2370, section 2001, Mexico: A Cultural Perspective. This theme-driven, multicultural, interdisciplinary course will study the historical, political, social, religious, artistic and business traditions of Mexico. Students must have Internet access and a current e-mail address. Students may obtain a free e-mail account by logging onto www.BrookhavenCollege.edu, then click on "N" for NetMail.

class.description: The topic for this course is Aspects of Middle Eastern Cultures, which includes politics, arts and Islamic institutions and culture.

class.title: Composition II
class.description: Students will work toward a definition of the teacher/student relationship as evidenced in a series of films and essays that address this topic. They will study teaching and learning environments, assumptions and practices, and the role of both teacher and student.

class.description: The first class meets Sept. 1.
class.alt-description: The first class meets Sept. 1.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: This course examines the trials and tribulations faced by the hero on his journey toward enlightenment. Through this exploration, students will examine the meaning in their own journey in order to gain a greater insight into their purpose in life.
class.alt-description: This course examines the trials and tribulations faced by the hero on his journey toward enlightenment. Through this exploration, students will examine the meaning in their own journey in order to gain a greater insight into their purpose in life.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: This course will focus on the worldwide struggle for human rights as heard through the voices of the oppressed. Eye witness reports, guest speakers from human rights organizations, and films will help students gain a deeper under- standing of the need for all people to have dignity and respect.
class.alt-description: This course will focus on the worldwide struggle for human rights as heard through the voices of the oppressed. Eye witness reports, guest speakers from human rights organizations, and films will help students gain a deeper under- standing of the need for all people to have dignity and respect.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: The Holocaust and other Genocides: by focusing on the literature of the Holocaust (1939-1945) as well as historical readings and lectures, this course will show how people can be led to believe in the necessity of destroying their fellow human beings and the disasters which result. This course will include a visit to the Dallas Memorial Center for Holocaust Studies and lectures from survivors and liberators of the concentration camps.
class.alt-description: The Holocaust and other Genocides: by focusing on the literature of the Holocaust (1939-1945) as well as historical readings and lectures, this course will show how people can be led to believe in the necessity of destroying their fellow human beings and the disasters which result. This course will include a visit to the Dallas Memorial Center for Holocaust Studies and lectures from survivors and liberators of the concentration camps.

class.title: Hist Geology
class.description: GEOL 1404-2250 is a weekend college course for science or non-science majors. The class will meet monthly on Friday evenings, Saturdays and Sundays - Sept 7-9, Oct 12-14, Oct 26-28, Nov 16-18, Dec 1-2 and Dec 7 for Final Exam. Weekends will have on-campus lectures/discussions/labs. Attendance is required at all class sessions.

class.title: American Government
class.description: This course is part of the Fall 2007 Coordinated Studies program which meets MTWR from 9-11:50 a.m. Students must enroll in 12 credit hours and complete a registration form in person at the BHC Advising Center, Room S113. For more information contact Ahad Hayaud-Din at aDin@dcccd.edu. The topic of the program is "America at the Crossroads". This program will be limited to 90 students.

class.title: Learning Framework
class.description: Students enrolling in HDEV 1300-2001 must also be enrolled in the accelerated DMAT 0098-2202 and DMAT 0097-2202 combination courses. HDEV 1300 will help students develop skills that will support their success in college. Topics include motivation and self-discipline, time management, effective communication, understanding the psychology of the classroom, note- and test taking skills, reading/writing, techniques, and developing critical thinking.
class.alt-description: New workbooks are required. Students enrolling in HDEV 1300-2001 must also be enrolled in the accelerated DMAT 0098-2202 and DMAT 0097-2202 combination courses.

class.title: Prin of Nutrit
class.description: This course is an introduction to human nutrition. In addition to learning how the body handles nutrients, students analyze personal eating habits; develop a personal weight control plan; analyze food labels; distinguish between nutrition fact and myth; identify relationships between nutrition and disease; and integrate nutrition information into daily lives. All sections have an Internet component. MANDATORY: Internet access and an e-mail account.
class.alt-description: This course is an introduction to human nutrition. In addition to learning how the body handles nutrients, students analyze personal eating habits; develop a personal weight control plan; analyze food labels; distinguish between nutrition fact and myth; identify relationships between nutrition and disease; and integrate nutrition information into daily lives. All sections have an Internet component. MANDATORY: Internet access and an e-mail account.

class.title: Prin of Nutrit
class.description: This section has a modified Tuesday/Thursday class meeting schedule. Some meetings are traditional and others will be assigned group activities and/or Internet activities. Details will be discussed at first class meeting.

Students should not buy used telecourse guides.

class.title: Beginning Tai Chi Chuan
class.description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form characterized by low, non-impact movements designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.
class.alt-description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form characterized by low, non-impact movements designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.

class.title: Beginning Yoga/Pilates
class.description: This combination course is designed for beginning to intermediate students. It utilizes low-impact aerobic warmups, poses and calisthenics to improve flexibility, balance and posture as well as to equalize muscle strength throughout the body. Focus will be on breathing and relaxation.
class.alt-description: This combination course is designed for beginning to intermediate students. class.title: Beg Cond Exercise
class.description: This course is an overall fitness class designed for students 50 years and older. It includes cardiovascular walking and rhythmic activities; weight training using small free weights and tubing; and flexibility training. Accommodation will be made for different levels of fitness.

class.title: Beginning Self Defense
class.description: This course utilizes both Northern and Southern styles of the Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach basic self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform is required and will be discussed at first class.

class.title: Inter Cond Exercise
class.description: This intermediate course, designed for students 50 years and older, will incorporate a variety of exercises to improve cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength and endurance and flexibility. Cardiovascular walking and rhythmic activities, weight training using small free weights and tubing are also included. Accommodation will be made for different levels of fitness.

class.title: Inter Yoga/Pilates
class.description: This combination course is designed for beginning to intermediate students. It utilizes low-impact aerobic warmups, poses and calisthenics to improve flexibility, balance and posture as well as to equalize muscle strength throughout the body. Focus will be on breathing and relaxation.

class.description: This course is part of the Fall 2007 Coordinated Studies program which meets MTWR from 9-11:50 a.m. Students must enroll in 12 credit hours and complete a registration form in person at the BHC Advising Center, Room S113. For more information contact Delryn Fleming at delryn@dcccd.edu. The topic of the course is "America at the Crossroads". The program is limited to 90 students.

class.title: Social & Political Philosophy
class.description: In today's global world, universal questions concerning government and society take on increased importance. This senior adult course will examine topics such as who has a right to rule; should I obey the law; government and morality; resolving disagreements; and what is justice.

class.title: Intro General Physics
class.description: PHYS 1401 is an algebra/trigonometry-based physics course for pre-dental, pre-pharmacy and pre-architecture majors and other students who need a two-semester technical course in physics. It is recommended that students take MATH 1414 (College Algebra) and MATH 1316 (Trigonometry) prior to taking PHYS 1401.

class.description: Orientation for PHYS 1411-2426 online course will be Aug. 29, 6-7 p.m. in Room K251. PHYS 1411 is a Core Curriculum course for non-science majors and includes the study of planetary astronomy.

class.title: Google for Genealogy, Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2201 will teach students how to find genealogical information using search engines. In this four-session course, you will also learn how to effectively use genealogical mailing lists using g-mail, techniques for writing queries, how to use the U.S GenWeb project, and how to save documents, maps and images. Using Internet and non-Internet sources, researchers will learn the best methods and resources for locating and evaluating information used for genealogical purposes. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP and Internet I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2201 will teach students how to find genealogical information using search engines. In this four-session course, you will also learn how to effectively use genealogical mailing lists using g-mail, techniques for writing queries, how to use the U.S GenWeb project, and how to save documents, maps and images. Using Internet and non-Internet sources, researchers will learn the best methods and resources for locating and evaluating information used for genealogical purposes. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP and Internet I.

class.title: Google for Genealogy, Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2202 will introduce students to Google Images, Alerts, Maps and Earth, as well as how to search book collections for digital images to assist in genealogical research. In this four-session course, you will learn to view, navigate, extract, print and save information in online documents. Using Internet and non-Internet sources, researchers will learn the best methods and resources for locating and evaluating information used for genealogical purposes. Prerequisite: Google for Genealogy Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2202 will introduce students to Google Images, Alerts, Maps and Earth, as well as how to search book collections for digital images to assist in genealogical research. In this four-session course, you will learn to view, navigate, extract, print and save information in online documents. Using Internet and non-Internet sources, researchers will learn the best methods and resources for locating and evaluating information used for genealogical purposes. Prerequisite: Google for Genealogy Part I.

class.title: Digital Camera
class.description: POFI 1104-2203 will cover the various features of a digital camera. In this six-session course students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2203 will cover the various features of a digital camera. In this six-session course students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.

class.title: Digital Camera
class.description: POFI 1104-2204 will cover the various features of a digital camera. In this six-session course students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. class.title: Computer Literacy/Basic Skills
class.description: POFI 1104-2205 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this five-session course, students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing Basic Computer you will be ready to enroll in Intro to Computers/Windows XP.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2205 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this five-session course, students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing Basic Computer you will be ready to enroll in Intro to Computers/Windows XP.

class.title: Computer Literacy/Basic Skills
class.description: POFI 1104-2206 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this six-session course, students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing the Computer Literacy you will be ready to enroll in Windows XP or Vista.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2206 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this six-session course, students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing the Computer Literacy you will be ready to enroll in Windows XP or Vista.

class.title: Advanced E-Mail
class.description: POFI 1104-2207 will explore how to use e-mail clients such as Outlook and Thunderbird, as well as using WebMail to check your bulk folder. In this six-session course, students will learn how to configure message filters, group lists, stationery, v-cards, signatures, encryption and attachments. Prerequisite: Internet I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2207 will explore how to use e-mail clients such as Outlook and Thunderbird, as well as using WebMail to check your bulk folder. In this six-session course, students will learn how to configure message filters, group lists, stationery, v-cards, signatures, encryption and attachments. Prerequisite: Internet I.

class.title: Collage/Photoshop
class.description: POFI 1104-2208 will enable you to learn to create collages by arranging and blending together digital images, drawings, text and scanned images to create an artistic composition for a variety of collage projects. Prerequisite for this six-session course: Photoshop Elements I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2208 will enable you to learn to create collages by arranging and blending together digital images, drawings, text and scanned images to create an artistic composition for a variety of collage projects. Prerequisite for this six-session course: Photoshop Elements I.

class.title: Data Security
class.description: POFI 1104-2209 covers how to protect your personal computer from viruses, "phishing," hacker penetrations, "spoofing," hidden spyware and e-mail identity theft schemes. In this six-session course you will learn techniques to protect data stored on your computer, how to manage your passwords and reduce the amount of unwanted e-mail. You also will learn how to download and install free programs to protect yourself and your computer. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2209 covers how to protect your personal computer from viruses, "phishing," hacker penetrations, "spoofing," hidden spyware and e-mail identity theft schemes. In this six-session course you will learn techniques to protect data stored on your computer, how to manage your passwords and reduce the amount of unwanted e-mail. You also will learn how to download and install free programs to protect yourself and your computer. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Excel 2007/Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2210 will develop skills in the basics of Microsoft Excel, a program for spreadsheet and arithmetic functions. This six-session course will include creating and editing spreadsheets, naming, saving and printing spreadsheets; navigating within worksheets; menus, shortcuts and toolbars for formatting spreadsheets and writing basic formulas. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2210 will develop skills in the basics of Microsoft Excel, a program for spreadsheet and arithmetic functions. This six-session course will include creating and editing spreadsheets, naming, saving and printing spreadsheets; navigating within worksheets; menus, shortcuts and toolbars for formatting spreadsheets and writing basic formulas. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Internet I
class.description: POFI 1104-2211 is a six-session course that emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. This course will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2211 is a six-session course that emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. This course will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Internet I
class.description: POFI 1104-2212 is a six-session course that emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. This course will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but also will discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Internet II
class.description: POFI 1104-2213 will cover advanced e-mail functions, advanced and quick searches, and shortcuts to addressing Web sites. In this six-session course, students will learn how to download programs such as games and Adobe Acrobat Reader, manage pop-ups, spam mail, cookies and avoid viruses. How to personalize the Internet experience and use calendars also will be explained. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2213 will cover advanced e-mail functions, advanced and quick searches, and shortcuts to addressing Web sites. In this six-session course, students will learn how to download programs such as games and Adobe Acrobat Reader, manage pop-ups, spam mail, cookies and avoid viruses. How to personalize the Internet experience and use calendars also will be explained. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Photoshop Elements I
class.description: POFI 1104-2214 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. In this six-session course, you also will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2214 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. In this six-session course, you also will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Photoshop Elements II
class.description: POFI 1104-2215 will build on skills from Photoshop Elements Part I and will cover how to correct color and exposure as well as dust and spot removal. In this six-session course you will also use the clone tool to repair damage and remove unwanted parts of the photo. Recommended prerequisite: Photoshop Elements I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2215 will build on skills from Photoshop Elements Part I and will cover how to correct color and exposure as well as dust and spot removal. In this six-session course you will also use the clone tool to repair damage and remove unwanted parts of the photo. Recommended prerequisite: Photoshop Elements I.

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part III
class.description: POFI 1104-2216 will build on skills from Photoshop Elements Part II. Students will work on a project as well as learn different ways to creating masks to isolate specific areas of photos and how to work with various types of layers, including text layers. In this six-session course, you will also experiment with blend modes and plug-in filters. Required prerequisite: Photoshop Elements II.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2216 will build on skills from Photoshop Elements Part II. Students will work on a project as well as learn different ways to creating masks to isolate specific areas of photos and how to work with various types of layers, including text layers. In this six-session course, you will also experiment with blend modes and plug-in filters. Required prerequisite: Photoshop Elements II.

class.title: Tips and Tricks
class.description: POFI 1104-2217 will deal with improving computer performance and/or fixing problems. On the Windows XP desktop, students will learn to navigate, customize, organize, eliminate clutter and speed up the boot process. In Internet Explorer, you will organize and manage favorites, cookies, browser history and troubleshoot connection problems. Tips will be given to help deal with spam in e-mail, organizing what you want to keep and eliminating clutter. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2217 will deal with improving computer performance and/or fixing problems. On the Windows XP desktop, students will learn to navigate, customize, organize, eliminate clutter and speed up the boot process. In Internet Explorer, you will organize and manage favorites, cookies, browser history and troubleshoot connection problems. Tips will be given to help deal with spam in e-mail, organizing what you want to keep and eliminating clutter. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Users Group/Problem Solving
class.description: POFI 1104-2218 meets four times during the semester. Each session of this course will have a program and demonstrations to increase your knowledge of computers, computer software, and the Internet. In addition, students will have an opportunity to ask questions about various computer software problems they have encountered. This course meets on Fridays: Sept. 7, Oct. 5, Nov. 2 and Dec. 7.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2218 meets four times during the semester. Each session of this course will have a program and demonstrations to increase your knowledge of computers, computer software, and the Internet. In addition, students will have an opportunity to ask questions about various computer software problems they have encountered. This course meets on Fridays: Sept. 7, Oct. 5, Nov. 2 and Dec. 7.

class.title: Word 2007/PART I
class.description: POFI 1104-2219 will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. This six-session course includes creating and editing Word documents; naming, saving and printing documents; menus, toolbars and shortcuts; formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text; margins and indents; and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2219 will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. This six-session course includes creating and editing Word documents; naming, saving and printing documents; menus, toolbars and shortcuts; formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text; margins and indents; and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Word 2007/Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2220 builds on the concepts learned in Word Part I to work with columns, paragraph numbering, graphics, section breaks and creating envelopes and labels. This six-session course will include how to merge a database of names and addresses into a standard "boilerplate" for mail merge, as well as how to change Word's default settings and refine your knowledge of advanced table techniques. Required prerequisite: Word Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2220 builds on the concepts learned in Word Part I to work with columns, paragraph numbering, graphics, section breaks and creating envelopes and labels. This six-session course will include how to merge a database of names and addresses into a standard "boilerplate" for mail merge, as well as how to change Word's default settings and refine your knowledge of advanced table techniques. Required prerequisite: Word Part I.

class.title: Tracing Your Family Tree/Pt I
class.description: POFI 1104-2221 is a four-session course introducing you to sources for searching family records. Classroom lecture will be combined with hands-on computer work.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2221 is a four-session course introducing you to sources for searching family records. Classroom lecture will be combined with hands-on computer work.

class.title: PowerPoint 2007
class.description: POFI 1104-2222 is a presentation program that can be used with digital photos, text, clip art and objects. This software enables you to create presentations of memorable events, such as birthdays, anniversaries, weddings or vacations. It also can be used to create life stories of family members or yourself. In this six-session course you will also learn how to enhance basic presentations using custom animations, transition effects, drawing objects, 3D effects and re-coloring. MANDATORY Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Beginning Word.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2222 is a presentation program that can be used with digital photos, text, clip art and objects. This software enables you to create presentations of memorable events, such as birthdays, anniversaries, weddings or vacations. It also can be used to create life stories of family members or yourself. In this six-session course you will also learn how to enhance basic presentations using custom animations, transition effects, drawing objects, 3D effects and re-coloring. MANDATORY Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Beginning Word.

class.title: Publisher 2007
class.description: POFI 1104-2223 will introduce the design of a variety of publications, such as greeting cards, invitations, fliers, newsletters, postcards, calendars, business cards and signs. This six-session course will also cover predefined layouts that may be used to simplify formatting your publication if you do not design your own layout.

class.description: POFI 1104-2253 is a five-session course that will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. In this course, you also will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Web Page I
class.description: POFI 1104-2254 is a five-session course that will focus on designing a simple personal or business Web site and covers how to put photos online and create e-mail links. You will learn about free or inexpensive Web site hosting for your personal site. No prior knowledge of Web design is required. Students must be able to attend all five classes. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

You will learn about free or inexpensive Web site hosting for your personal site. No prior knowledge of Web design is required. Students must be able to attend all five classes. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Web Page II
class.description: POFI 1104-2255 is a five-session course and will build upon the skills of Web Page I by adding to your Web site. You will review how to design a Web site, format lists and tables, create custom graphics and add new pages and links. Students must be able to attend all five classes. Prerequisite: Web Page Design Part I.

class.title: Photoshop Elements I
class.description: POFI 1104-2257 is a five-session course and will cover importing, organizing and enhancing photos. Skills will be developed in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red-eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2257 is a five-session course and will cover importing, organizing and enhancing photos. Skills will be developed in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red-eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Web Page Design I
class.description: POFI 1104-2258 is a five-session course and will focus on designing a simple personal or business Web site and will cover how to put photos online and create e-mail links. Free or inexpensive Web site hosting for personal use will be covered. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2258 is a five-session course and will focus on designing a simple personal or business Web site and will cover how to put photos online and create e-mail links. Free or inexpensive Web site hosting for personal use will be covered. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Web Page Design II
class.description: POFI 1104-2259 is a five-session course and is a continuation of Web Page Design I. Students will review how to design a Web site, format lists and tables, create custom graphics and add new pages and links. Required prerequiste: Beginning Web Page Design Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2259 is a five-session course and is a continuation of Web Page Design I. Students will review how to design a Web site, format lists and tables, create custom graphics and add new pages and links. Required prerequiste: Beginning Web Page Design Part I.

class.title: Intro to Comp/Windows XP
class.description: POFI 1204-2200 is a beginning computer course that focuses on the terminology of the Microsoft Windows XP operating system. In this 12-session course, components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. Students will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.

In this 12-session course, components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. Students will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.

course.title: Spc Tpcs in Spanish Lang/Liter
course.long-title: Special Topics in Spanish Language and Literature

class.title: Beginning Spanish
class.description: In this 10-week course you will build a beginning vocabulary, basic grammar and pronunciation skills. Comprehension will increase as you participate in listening and speaking exercises with classmates and the instructor. Instructional materials will be used as a way to increase skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: In this 10-week course you will build a beginning vocabulary, basic grammar and pronunciation skills. Comprehension will increase as you participate in listening and speaking exercises with classmates and the instructor. Instructional materials will be used as a way to increase skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.

class.title: Intermediate Spanish
class.description: Recommended Prerequisite: Beginning Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course is a continuation of Beginning Spanish and seeks to develop additional vocabulary and speaking skills. You will continue oral practice, as well as the reading, writing, and grammar skills necessary to enhance your communication and comprehension skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: Recommended Prerequisite: Beginning Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course is a continuation of Beginning Spanish and seeks to develop additional vocabulary and speaking skills. You will continue oral practice, as well as the reading, writing, and grammar skills necessary to enhance your communication and comprehension skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.

class.title: Special Topics in Spanish
class.description: RECOMMENDED PREREQUISITE: Intermediate Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course will include a grammar and vocabulary review, a survey of literature, current topics, cultural videos and discussion. New topics will be introduced each semester. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: RECOMMENDED PREREQUISITE: Intermediate Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course will include a grammar and vocabulary review, a survey of literature, current topics, cultural videos and discussion. New topics will be introduced each semester. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
